sec.p: As the yet unidentified filarial species was exclusively found in Culex mosquitoes, it is not surprising that it was most abundant in those places where mainly Culex spp. were caught using gravid traps, which were Weinheim and Großsachsen (Figure 1). Only three positive pools originated from the site at Wagbachniederung in 2009. All three sites are located in the north of the state of Baden-Württemberg (see also below).
Setaria tundra appears to be more widespread: it was found in various mosquito species in the states of Bavaria, Rhineland-Palatinate and Baden-Württemberg.
